Start Point: (0.0, 0.5627), Mid Point: (0.0202, 0.375), End Point: (0.0, 0.1873) * Close the loop. * Create a second loop with a circle at the center: + Center: (0.1509, 0.5956), Radius: 0.0551. 1. Scale the complete sketch by a factor of 0.75. 2. Extrude the scaled sketch in the positive Z direction by 0.0221 units using a NewBodyFeatureOperation. The final dimensions of part 1 are Length = 0.75, Width = 0.0221, Height = 0.75. Part 2 Instructions Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. 1. Set up the coordinate system with the Euler angles set to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the Translation Vector set to [0.0993, 0.0, 0.0993]. 2. Draw face 1: * Create a loop with a single circle: + Center: (0.0551, 0.0551), Radius: 0.0551. 1. Scale the entire sketch by a factor of 0.1103. 2. Perform a CutFeatureOperation to remove material from the previously constructed part by extruding the Sketch in the negative Z direction by 0.0221 units. The final dimensions of part 2 are Length = 0.1103, Width = 0.0221, Height = 0.1103. Combine the parts to create the final CAD model of a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center, with flat base and flat top, and a height equal to the prism. The cylindrical axis and height are the same, with symmetry along the axis as described in the input.</description>

Sketch: Face 2 Create another 2D sketch on the same plane defined by the coordinate system. 1. Draw a line (line\\_1) from the point (0.0, 0.0) to the point (0.375, 0.0). 2. Draw a line (line\\_2) from the point (0.375, 0.0) to the point (0.375, 0.75). 3. Draw a line (line\\_3) from the point (0.375, 0.75) to the point (0.0, 0.75). 4. Extrusion Extrude the two sketches along the Z-axis by 0.5689 units (towards the normal) and 0.0 units (opposite the normal). Scale the sketch by 0.75. This results in the creation of a new solid body that represents the three-dimensional rectangular prism described in the assembly JSON.
